definitions: territory governed by a duke or duchess as sovereign
hereditary rank and title of a duke in nobility
examples: The dukedom stretched across three counties with vast estates
His dukedom included several prosperous towns and villages
He inherited the dukedom after his father's death unexpectedly
The dukedom carried significant political influence in Parliament

definitions: trapezoidal stringed instrument played with light hammers or by plucking
examples: She played the dulcimer at the folk music festival
The mountain dulcimer produces a distinctive melodic sound beautifully
His hammered dulcimer performance captivated the entire audience completely
The dulcimer strings resonated through the concert hall magnificently

definitions: short bar with weighted ends used for strength training exercises
examples: She lifted the dumbbells during her morning workout routine
The gym had dumbbells ranging from five to hundred pounds
He bought adjustable dumbbells for his home gym setup
Dumbbell exercises target specific muscle groups more effectively than machines

definitions: life-sized model of a human figure used for display
substitute or placeholder object used temporarily in place of something
rubber or plastic nipple given to babies for comfort
examples: The store dummy displayed the latest fashion collection elegantly
Crash test dummies help engineers improve vehicle safety standards
The programmer used dummy data to test the application
They placed a dummy camera to deter potential thieves
The baby settled down after getting her dummy back
British parents often call a pacifier a dummy instead

definitions: place where garbage and waste materials are deposited
complete transfer of data from memory to storage device
informal term for an unpleasant or dilapidated place
examples: The municipal dump processes thousands of tons weekly
They took old furniture to the local dump yesterday
The system dump revealed critical errors in the code
Database dumps are essential for backup and recovery procedures
This apartment is a real dump needing major renovations
We stayed in a dump of a hotel unfortunately

definitions: act of disposing waste materials in designated or illegal locations
selling products in foreign markets below cost to eliminate competition
examples: Illegal dumping pollutes rivers and natural habitats severely
The dumping of toxic waste requires special permits nationwide
Anti-dumping laws protect domestic industries from unfair competition
Steel dumping accusations led to international trade disputes recently

definitions: small piece of dough filled with meat or vegetables and cooked
examples: Chinese dumplings are traditionally eaten during New Year celebrations
She ordered pork dumplings with soy dipping sauce
The soup contained fluffy dumplings floating on the surface
Potato dumplings complement the hearty beef stew perfectly

definitions: hill or ridge of sand formed by wind action typically near beaches or deserts
examples: The sand dunes shifted constantly with the desert winds
Children love sliding down the coastal dunes in summer
Protected dune systems provide crucial habitat for wildlife species
The Sahara contains some of Earth's largest sand dunes

definitions: solid waste material excreted by animals used as fertilizer
examples: Farmers spread cow dung across fields as natural fertilizer
Elephant dung provides nutrients for numerous insect species
Dried dung serves as fuel in many rural communities
The stable workers cleared dung from the horse stalls

definitions: dark underground prison cell typically found in castles or fortresses
examples: Medieval dungeons held prisoners in terrible conditions for years
The castle dungeon tour showed authentic torture devices
Fantasy games often feature dungeons filled with monsters
Prisoners rarely survived long in the castle's dank dungeon

definitions: forceful downward thrust of basketball through hoop with hands
quick immersion of food into liquid before eating
examples: His spectacular dunk earned a standing ovation from fans
The slam dunk contest showcases amazing athletic ability yearly
She likes to dunk cookies in milk before eating
Don't dunk your bread in the soup at restaurants

definitions: two people performing together especially in music or entertainment
examples: The comedy duo toured theaters across the country successfully
The musical duo harmonized beautifully during their concert performance
Batman and Robin remain comics' most famous crime-fighting duo
The duo collaborated on three platinum albums together

definitions: person who has been deceived or tricked into believing something false
examples: The con artist's dupe lost thousands in the scam
Don't be a dupe for false advertising claims online
Many dupes fell for the pyramid scheme's promises unfortunately
The politician treated voters like dupes with empty promises

definitions: residential building divided into two separate living units sharing walls
examples: They bought a duplex and rented out one side
The duplex offers privacy while generating rental income monthly
Our duplex has separate entrances for each unit conveniently
Converting houses into duplexes increases neighborhood housing density

definitions: identical copy or reproduction of an original document or object
examples: Keep a duplicate of important documents in separate locations
The duplicate key saved them during the lockout emergency
She discovered a duplicate charge on her credit statement
Museums display duplicates while preserving original artifacts safely

definitions: process of making exact copies or unnecessary repetition of effort
examples: Gene duplication drives evolutionary changes in organisms over time
Document duplication wastes paper and storage space unnecessarily
Avoiding duplication of work improves team efficiency significantly
The duplication of research efforts costs millions annually

definitions: deliberate deceptiveness in behavior or speech showing contradictory attitudes
examples: His duplicity shocked friends who trusted him completely before
Political duplicity undermines public trust in democratic institutions
The spy's duplicity fooled both sides for years successfully
Corporate duplicity regarding safety violations sparked public outrage

definitions: ability to withstand wear, pressure, or damage over extended time periods
examples: The product's durability justifies its higher price point
Testing durability ensures products meet quality standards consistently
Concrete durability depends on proper mixing and curing methods
The fabric's durability makes it ideal for outdoor furniture

definitions: length of time something continues or exists from beginning to end
examples: The meeting's duration exceeded three hours yesterday afternoon
Flight duration from London to Tokyo is twelve hours
The medication's duration of effect varies between patients significantly
Contract duration typically spans two to five years

definitions: darker stage of twilight when sun is below horizon in evening
examples: Mosquitoes become most active at dusk during summer months
The photographer captured stunning colors at dusk yesterday
Street lights automatically activate at dusk for safety reasons
Wildlife emerges from hiding places at dusk to feed

definitions: fine dry particles of matter such as earth or pollen
fine powder of any substance reduced to minute particles
examples: Dust accumulated on the unused furniture over months
Desert winds carry dust particles across continents annually
Gold dust sparkled in the prospector's pan excitedly
The explosion reduced the building to dust and rubble

definitions: container for household refuse typically kept outside homes in Britain
examples: Empty the dustbin before the collection truck arrives tomorrow
Raccoons knocked over the dustbin searching for food scraps
The dustbin overflowed with garbage after the holiday weekend
Recycling bins stand next to regular dustbins now

definitions: cloth or brush for removing dust from surfaces and objects
examples: She used a feather duster on the delicate ornaments
The microfiber duster attracts dust particles effectively without chemicals
Keep a duster handy for quick cleaning between thorough sessions
The extendable duster reaches high ceiling fan blades

definitions: moral or legal obligation requiring responsible action or conduct
task or action required as part of one's job or role
tax levied on imported or exported goods by government
examples: Citizens have a duty to vote in democratic elections
Parental duty includes providing children with proper education
Night duty requires staying alert despite exhaustion levels
Military duty demands personal sacrifice for national security
Import duties protect domestic industries from foreign competition
Customs duty on luxury goods generates significant revenue

definitions: person with a medical condition resulting in short stature
mythical creature typically depicted as small, stocky, and skilled
star of relatively small size and low luminosity including the sun
examples: The dwarf actor advocates for disability rights in Hollywood
Medical advances help people with dwarfism lead fulfilling lives
Fantasy dwarves excel at metalworking and mining underground
Tolkien's dwarves shaped modern fantasy literature significantly
White dwarf stars represent the final evolutionary stage
Our sun is classified as a yellow dwarf star

definitions: medical condition of short stature resulting from genetic or medical causes
examples: Achondroplasia is the most common form of dwarfism
Dwarfism affects approximately one in 25,000 births worldwide
Organizations support families dealing with dwarfism challenges compassionately
Medical understanding of dwarfism has improved treatment options significantly

definitions: person or animal that lives in or at a specified place
examples: City dwellers often miss the tranquility of rural areas
Cave dwellers adapted to complete darkness over generations
Apartment dwellers share common spaces with their neighbors daily
Forest dwellers possess intimate knowledge of their environment

definitions: place where someone lives including houses, apartments, or other shelters
examples: The census counts every dwelling in the district systematically
Ancient cliff dwellings reveal sophisticated architectural knowledge
Affordable dwellings remain scarce in major metropolitan areas
The dwelling showed signs of recent habitation clearly

definitions: process of gradually becoming smaller, fewer, or less over time
examples: The dwindling of natural resources concerns environmentalists worldwide
Budget dwindling forced program cuts across all departments
Dwindling attendance threatened the festival's future viability significantly
The dwindling daylight signals winter's approach in northern regions

definitions: substance used to add color to textiles, hair, or other materials
examples: Natural dye from plants creates beautiful earth tones
The fabric dye lasted through multiple washing cycles
Hair dye can dramatically change someone's appearance instantly
Food dye makes desserts more visually appealing to children

definitions: process of adding color to textiles or other materials using dyes
examples: Traditional dyeing techniques produce unique textile patterns worldwide
The dyeing process requires precise temperature control throughout
Tie-dyeing became popular during the 1960s counterculture movement
Industrial dyeing consumes significant water and energy resources

definitions: person whose occupation involves dyeing cloth or other materials
examples: The master dyer created custom colors for luxury fabrics
Medieval dyers formed powerful guilds in European cities
Professional dyers understand chemistry and color theory deeply
The dyer matched the exact shade requested perfectly

definitions: process of approaching death or being in final stages of life
gradual disappearance or extinction of something once common or vital
examples: The dying patient received compassionate hospice care services
Dying cells trigger immune responses in healthy tissue
The dying art of calligraphy needs younger practitioners urgently
Rural communities struggle with dying industries and unemployment

definitions: embankment built to prevent flooding from sea or river
sheet of rock formed in vertical fissure by molten material
examples: The dyke protected low-lying farmland from tidal flooding
Netherlands maintains extensive dyke systems against North Sea
Volcanic dykes create distinctive patterns in cliff faces
Geologists studied the ancient dyke formation for mineral deposits

definitions: force that stimulates change or progress within a system or process
examples: Group dynamics influence team productivity and morale significantly
The family dynamic changed after the youngest left home
Market dynamics shift rapidly with technological innovations emerging
Understanding classroom dynamics helps teachers manage behavior effectively

definitions: quality of being characterized by vigorous activity and progress
examples: Economic dynamism drives innovation and job creation nationally
Her leadership dynamism transformed the struggling department completely
Urban dynamism attracts young professionals seeking opportunities
The company's dynamism stems from its entrepreneurial culture

definitions: powerful explosive made of nitroglycerin absorbed in stabilizing material
something or someone that causes excitement or has great impact
examples: Construction crews used dynamite to blast through solid rock
Alfred Nobel invented dynamite in 1867 for safer mining
The new restaurant's food is absolute dynamite worth trying
That performance was dynamite from start to finish

definitions: machine for converting mechanical energy into electrical energy
person with boundless energy and enthusiasm for activities
examples: The bicycle dynamo powers lights without requiring batteries
Early dynamos provided electricity for industrial machinery
She's a dynamo who manages three businesses successfully
The new coach is a dynamo inspiring the entire team

definitions: succession of rulers from the same family or line over generations
examples: The Ming dynasty ruled China for nearly three centuries
Egypt's pharaonic dynasties spanned thousands of years historically
The business dynasty passed leadership through five generations
Sports dynasties dominate their leagues for extended periods

definitions: abnormality or impairment in the functioning of a system, organ, or relationship
examples: Kidney dysfunction requires immediate medical attention and treatment
Family dysfunction often stems from poor communication patterns
Organizational dysfunction reduces productivity and employee satisfaction significantly
Cognitive dysfunction affects memory and decision-making abilities

definitions: learning disorder characterized by difficulty reading despite normal intelligence levels
examples: Dyslexia affects how the brain processes written language
Students with dyslexia benefit from specialized teaching methods
Early dyslexia diagnosis enables effective intervention strategies
Many successful people have overcome dyslexia challenges creatively

definitions: person who has dyslexia affecting their reading and writing abilities
examples: The dyslexic student uses assistive technology for reading
Many dyslexic individuals excel in creative and spatial thinking
Dyslexic entrepreneurs often think outside conventional business models
Support groups help dyslexic children build confidence academically

definitions: imagined society characterized by oppression, suffering, and systemic injustice
examples: The novel depicts a dystopia where technology controls humanity
Environmental collapse creates a dystopia in the film
Modern dystopias reflect contemporary anxieties about future societies
The dystopia warned against totalitarian government control methods

definitions: large bird of prey with powerful hooked beak and excellent vision
examples: The bald eagle symbolizes American strength and freedom
Eagles can spot prey from miles away accurately
Golden eagles hunt rabbits in mountainous terrain skillfully
The eagle soared majestically above the canyon walls

definitions: organ of hearing and balance located on each side of the head
seed-bearing spike of cereal plants such as wheat or corn
examples: The doctor examined her ear for signs of infection
Human ears can detect frequencies between 20 and 20,000 hertz
Corn ears mature approximately 20 days after silk emergence
Each wheat ear contains multiple grain kernels arranged systematically

definitions: pain inside the ear often caused by infection or pressure
examples: The child's earache kept him awake all night
Swimming in cold water sometimes causes temporary earaches
Persistent earaches require medical evaluation to prevent complications
Flying with an earache can be extremely painful

definitions: thin membrane separating outer ear from middle ear that vibrates with sound
examples: Loud explosions can rupture the eardrum causing hearing loss
The eardrum vibrates when sound waves strike it
Perforated eardrums usually heal naturally within several weeks
Doctors use otoscopes to examine eardrum health visually

definitions: British nobleman ranking below marquess and above viscount in hierarchy
examples: The earl inherited vast estates in northern England
Earl Grey tea was named after a British earl
The earl's ancestral home opened for public tours recently
Medieval earls wielded significant political and military power

definitions: territory under an earl's jurisdiction or the rank of earl
examples: The earldom included three counties and numerous villages
He inherited the earldom after his father's death
The ancient earldom dates back to Norman conquest times
Creating new earldoms requires royal approval in Britain

definitions: person who earns money through employment or business activities
examples: Primary earners support their families with steady incomes
High earners often face increased tax obligations annually
The household has two earners sharing financial responsibilities equally
Top earners in the company receive performance bonuses
